intro: Acinodendron novemnerve, commonly known as the nine-veined acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with nine distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and stamens that are clustered around a central pistil. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
